an10.92:4.1: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,
an10.92:4.2: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an10.92:5.1: “Householder, when a noble disciple has quelled five dangers and threats, has the four factors of stream-entry, and has clearly seen and penetrated the noble process with wisdom, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
an10.92:5.2: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’
an10.92:6.1: What are the five dangers and threats they have quelled?
an10.92:6.2: Anyone who kills living creatures creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who avoids killing living creatures creates no dangers and threats either in the present life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.
an10.92:6.3: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who avoids killing living creatures.
an10.92:7.4: Anyone who uses alcohol and drugs that cause negligence creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who avoids using alcohol and drugs that cause negligence creates no dangers and threats either in the present life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.
an10.92:7.5: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who avoids using alcohol and drugs that cause negligence.
an10.92:7.6: These are the five dangers and threats they have quelled.
an10.92:8.1: What are the four factors of stream-entry that they have?
an10.92:8.2: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha:
an10.92:8.3: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme trainer of people, awakened, blessed.’
an10.92:8.5: They have experiential confidence in the teaching:
an10.92:8.6: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’
an10.92:8.7: They have experiential confidence in the Saṅgha:
an10.92:8.8: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, direct, principled, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, and worthy of greeting with folded palms. It is a supreme field of merit for the world.’
an10.92:8.9: And a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, uncorrupted, unflawed, unblemished, untainted, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to samādhi.
an10.92:8.10: These are the four factors of stream-entry that they have.
an10.92:9.1: And what is the noble process that they have clearly seen and penetrated  with wisdom?
an10.92:9.2: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:
an10.92:9.4: due to the arising of this, that arises.
an10.92:9.5: When this doesn’t exist, that is not;
an10.92:9.6: due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
an10.92:9.7: Ignorance is a condition for choices. Choices are a condition for consciousness. Consciousness is a condition for name and form. Name and form is a condition for the six sense fields. The six sense fields are conditions for contact. Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving. Craving is a condition for grasping. Grasping is a condition for future existence. Future existence is a condition for rebirth. Rebirth is a condition that gives rise to old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress. That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
an10.92:9.8: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease. When choices cease, consciousness ceases. When consciousness ceases, name and form cease. When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases. When contact ceases, feeling ceases. When feeling ceases, craving ceases. When craving ceases, grasping ceases. When grasping ceases, future existence ceases. When future existence ceases, rebirth ceases. When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress cease. That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
an10.92:9.10: This is the noble process that they have clearly seen and penetrated with wisdom.
an10.92:10.1: When a noble disciple has quelled five dangers and threats, has the four factors of stream-entry, and has clearly seen and penetrated the noble process with wisdom, they may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
an10.92:10.2: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’”
